item.title: CVE in Perl
item.description: DISCLAIMER: Image is generated using FREE version of ChatGPT. 1. What’s CVE? 2. Key Features 3. How CVE works? 4. Why CVE matters? 5. How to audit? 6. Why recreate CVEs? 7. Known CVEs 8. Recreate CVEs 9. Further Sources What’s CVE? CVE stands for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures. It is a publicly available dictionary of known cybersecurity vulnerabilities and exposures. It provides a standardised way to identify and track security issues in software and hardware systems.

item.title: Subroutine Signatures in Perl
item.description: DISCLAIMER: Image is generated using FREE version of ChatGPT. Subroutine Signatures in Perl NOTE: All credit for this article goes to the book Perl New Features by brian d foy. Have you ever missed subroutine signatures in Perl? I missed it a lot when I used to program in Java. Then when Raku introduced its coolest subroutine signatures, I started wondering, when would Perl get subroutine signatures?
